title: Implement ActivityPub Actor endpoint
description:
Implement ActivityPub Actor endpoint to serve account profile in ActivityPub format. **Endpoint:** `GET /users/{username}` with `Accept: application/activity+json` header **Response format:** ```json { "@context": [ "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "https://w3id.org/security/v1" ], "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "type": "Person", "preferredUsername": "stepan", "name": "Stepan Kuzmin", "summary": "

Your bio goes here

", "url": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/@stepan", "inbox": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/inbox", "outbox": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/outbox", "followers": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/followers", "following": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/following", "icon": { "type": "Image", "mediaType": "image/jpeg", "url": "https://avatars.githubusercontent.com/u/533564" }, "publicKey": { "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan#main-key", "owner": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "publicKeyPem": "-----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY-----\n...\n-----END PUBLIC KEY-----" } } ``` **Implementation notes:** - Check `Accept` header for `application/activity+json` or `application/ld+json` - Convert account.json data to ActivityPub format - Generate or load public key for HTTP signatures - Return appropriate content-type header - Add CORS headers **Dependencies:** - Requires WebFinger endpoint (octodon-9711) **References:** - ActivityPub spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/ - Mastodon Actor: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/activitypub/#Actor

title: Update build process to generate ActivityPub-formatted data
description:
Optionally update build.ts to pre-generate ActivityPub-formatted posts alongside Mastodon API format.

**Purpose:**
- Avoid converting posts from Mastodon format to ActivityPub format on every request
- Improve worker performance
- Maintain single source of truth in posts.json

**Current:**
```json
{
  "account": { /* Mastodon Account */ },
  "statuses": [ /* Mastodon Status objects */ ]
}
```

**Option A: Dual format in posts.json:**
```json
{
  "account": { /* Mastodon Account */ },
  "actor": { /* ActivityPub Actor */ },
  "statuses": [ /* Mastodon Status objects */ ],
  "activities": [ /* ActivityPub Create activities */ ]
}
```

**Option B: Separate files:**
- `posts.json` - Mastodon API format (existing)
- `actor.json` - ActivityPub Actor
- `outbox.json` - ActivityPub activities

**Option C: Convert on-the-fly (no build changes):**
- Keep current format
- Worker converts to ActivityPub when needed
- Simpler but slightly slower

**Implementation notes:**
- Option C is fine for low traffic
- Option A keeps everything in one place
- Consider file size impact
- May not be needed until performance becomes an issue

**Dependencies:**
- Only relevant after ActivityPub endpoints are implemented
- Can defer until performance testing

**Decision needed:**
- Test Option C first (no build changes)
- Only implement if performance is an issue

title: Enable ActivityPub federation support
description:
Implement ActivityPub protocol to enable federation with Mastodon and other fediverse servers.

**Goal:**
Allow users on other Mastodon instances (like mastodon.social) to follow and view posts from Octodon accounts by implementing the ActivityPub protocol.

**Current state:**
- ✅ Mastodon API endpoints (for client apps like Elk, Ivory)
- ❌ ActivityPub protocol (for server-to-server federation)

**Required components:**

**Phase 1: Discovery & Profile (P1 - High priority)**
- WebFinger endpoint (octodon-9711) - Required first
- ActivityPub Actor endpoint (octodon-0541)
- Individual Note/Object endpoints (octodon-85c2)

**Phase 2: Content Federation (P1 - High priority)**  
- Outbox endpoint (octodon-61de)
- Followers/Following collections (octodon-ccf3)

**Phase 3: Interactions (P2 - Medium priority)**
- Inbox endpoint (octodon-87e5)
- HTTP Signatures (octodon-6af9)

**Phase 4: Optimization (P3 - Low priority)**
- Build process updates (octodon-225e)

**Minimal viable federation:**
Implementing Phase 1 + Phase 2 enables:
- Discovery via WebFinger
- Viewing profile from other instances
- Fetching posts from Outbox
- **Basic read-only federation**

**Full federation:**
Adding Phase 3 enables:
- Accepting follow requests
- Follower tracking
- Secure authenticated requests

**Testing plan:**
1. Search for account on Mastodon.social
2. Verify profile loads
3. Verify posts appear
4. Test follow request (if Inbox implemented)

**Success criteria:**
User can search for `@stepan@octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev` on mastodon.social and see posts in their timeline.

**References:**
- ActivityPub spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/
- Mastodon federation: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/activitypub/
- Federation guide: https://blog.joinmastodon.org/2018/06/how-to-implement-a-basic-activitypub-server/

title: Implement OAuth authorization flow endpoints
description:
After implementing /api/v1/apps, Elk fails because it needs the full OAuth flow.

**Current error:**
Elk redirects to `/oauth/authorize` which returns 404.

**Missing endpoints:**
1. `GET /oauth/authorize` - Authorization page (should auto-approve and redirect)
2. `POST /oauth/token` - Exchange auth code for access token

**OAuth Flow:**
1. ✅ App registers via POST /api/v1/apps
2. ❌ User redirected to GET /oauth/authorize?client_id=...&redirect_uri=...
3. ❌ Server redirects back with code: redirect_uri?code=AUTH_CODE
4. ❌ App exchanges code via POST /oauth/token
5. ✅ App uses token for API calls (we accept anything since API is public)

**Implementation approach (stateless):**
- Generate deterministic auth codes from client_id (no storage)
- Auto-approve all requests (no user interaction needed)
- Return fake access tokens (API doesn't validate them anyway)
- Follow OAuth 2.0 response format

**Request example:**
```
GET /oauth/authorize?client_id=9b55fa90a42cc18af8e49ac5509725e3
  &response_type=code
  &redirect_uri=https://elk.zone/api/octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/oauth/https://elk.zone
  &scope=read+write+follow+push
```

**Blocks:** Elk preview functionality
**Related:** octodon-c516 (completed but incomplete)

title: Implement ActivityPub Outbox endpoint
description:
Implement ActivityPub Outbox endpoint to serve posts in ActivityPub format. **Endpoint:** `GET /users/{username}/outbox` with `Accept: application/activity+json` header **Response format (OrderedCollection):** ```json { "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/outbox", "type": "OrderedCollection", "totalItems": 3, "first": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/outbox?page=1" } ``` **Paginated response:** ```json { "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/outbox?page=1", "type": "OrderedCollectionPage", "partOf": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/outbox", "orderedItems": [ { "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/statuses/1737796500000/activity", "type": "Create", "actor": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "published": "2025-01-25T09:15:00.000Z", "object": { "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/statuses/1737796500000", "type": "Note", "attributedTo": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "content": "

Post content here

", "published": "2025-01-25T09:15:00.000Z", "to": ["https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams#Public"] } } ] } ``` **Implementation notes:** - Convert statuses from posts.json to ActivityPub Create activities - Support pagination (optional, could return all for now) - Each post becomes a Create activity wrapping a Note object - Use proper ActivityPub URLs (/users/stepan/statuses/ID) **Dependencies:** - Requires Actor endpoint (octodon-0541) **References:** - ActivityPub Outbox: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/#outbox - Mastodon implementation: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/activitypub/#outbox

title: Implement HTTP Signatures for ActivityPub security
description:
Implement HTTP Signature verification and signing for secure ActivityPub federation.

**Purpose:**
- Verify incoming activities to Inbox are from legitimate servers
- Sign outgoing activities when sending to other servers' inboxes
- Required for production federation (most servers reject unsigned requests)

**What's needed:**

**1. Generate RSA key pair:**
- Generate public/private key pair at build time or first run
- Store private key securely (Cloudflare secret or R2)
- Include public key in Actor endpoint response

**2. Verify incoming signatures:**
- Parse `Signature` header from incoming requests
- Fetch sender's public key from their Actor endpoint
- Verify request signature matches
- Reject requests with invalid signatures

**3. Sign outgoing requests:**
- Sign requests when sending activities to other servers
- Include `Signature` header with keyId, algorithm, headers, signature

**Signature header format:**
```
Signature: keyId="https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan#main-key",algorithm="rsa-sha256",headers="(request-target) host date digest",signature="..."
```

**Implementation notes:**
- Use Web Crypto API for RSA operations (available in Cloudflare Workers)
- Cache fetched public keys to avoid repeated requests
- For read-only mode (no outgoing activities), only verification needed
- Consider using `http-signature` library or implement manually

**Dependencies:**
- Required for production Inbox (octodon-87e5)
- Public key must be in Actor response (octodon-0541)

**References:**
- HTTP Signatures spec: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-cavage-http-signatures
- Mastodon implementation: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/security/#http
- Example: https://blog.joinmastodon.org/2018/06/how-to-implement-a-basic-activitypub-server/

title: Implement ActivityPub Note/Object endpoints for individual posts
description:
Implement ActivityPub endpoints to serve individual posts as Note objects. **Endpoints:** - `GET /users/{username}/statuses/{id}` with `Accept: application/activity+json` - `GET /users/{username}/statuses/{id}/activity` (Create activity wrapper) **Note object response:** ```json { "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/statuses/1737796500000", "type": "Note", "attributedTo": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "content": "

Post content in HTML

", "published": "2025-01-25T09:15:00.000Z", "to": ["https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams#Public"], "cc": ["https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/followers"], "url": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/@stepan/1737796500000" } ``` **Create activity response:** ```json { "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams", "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/statuses/1737796500000/activity", "type": "Create", "actor": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan", "published": "2025-01-25T09:15:00.000Z", "object": { /* Note object above */ } } ``` **Implementation notes:** - Convert individual status from posts.json to ActivityPub Note - Support both direct Note access and wrapped Create activity - Return 404 if status ID not found - Add proper content-type and CORS headers **Dependencies:** - Requires Actor endpoint (octodon-0541) **References:** - ActivityPub Note: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitystreams-vocabulary/#dfn-note - Mastodon statuses: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/activitypub/#Note

title: Implement ActivityPub Inbox endpoint for receiving activities
description:
Implement ActivityPub Inbox endpoint to receive federation activities (Follow, Like, Announce, etc.).

**Endpoint:** `POST /users/{username}/inbox` with `Content-Type: application/activity+json`

**Received activity examples:**

Follow request:
```json
{
  "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams",
  "id": "https://mastodon.social/users/alice#follows/123",
  "type": "Follow",
  "actor": "https://mastodon.social/users/alice",
  "object": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan"
}
```

**Implementation options:**

**Option A: Accept-only (minimal):**
- Accept POST requests
- Return 202 Accepted
- Don't store or process activities
- Allows basic federation discovery but no real interactions

**Option B: Auto-accept follows:**
- Store followers in R2 or KV
- Send Accept activity back to follower's inbox
- Requires HTTP signatures for sending activities
- Enables actual federation with follower notifications

**Implementation notes:**
- Verify HTTP signatures (required for production)
- Validate activity format
- For read-only mode, Option A is sufficient
- For full federation, need Option B + persistent storage

**Dependencies:**
- Requires Actor endpoint (octodon-0541)
- Option B requires HTTP signature implementation (see octodon-7f31)

**References:**
- ActivityPub Inbox: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/#inbox
- HTTP Signatures: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/security/#http

title: Implement WebFinger endpoint for account discovery
description:
Implement `.well-known/webfinger` endpoint to allow other Mastodon servers to discover accounts.

**Endpoint:** `GET /.well-known/webfinger?resource=acct:stepan@octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev`

**Response format:**
```json
{
  "subject": "acct:stepan@octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev",
  "aliases": [
    "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/@stepan",
    "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan"
  ],
  "links": [
    {
      "rel": "http://webfinger.net/rel/profile-page",
      "type": "text/html",
      "href": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/@stepan"
    },
    {
      "rel": "self",
      "type": "application/activity+json",
      "href": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan"
    }
  ]
}
```

**Implementation notes:**
- Parse `resource` query parameter
- Extract username from `acct:username@domain` format
- Validate username matches account.json
- Return 404 if username doesn't match
- Add proper CORS headers

**References:**
- WebFinger RFC: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7033
- Mastodon WebFinger: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/webfinger/

title: API returns 'Failed to load data' error after deployment
description:
After running npm run deploy, the API endpoint returns:
```
{"error":"Failed to load data"}
```

URL: https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/api/v1/timelines/public

**Likely cause:** The posts.json file may not have been uploaded to R2 with the --remote flag, or there's an R2 binding issue.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Deploy worker with `npm run deploy`
2. Curl the API endpoint
3. Receive error instead of data

**Next steps:**
1. Upload posts.json to R2 with: `npx wrangler r2 object put octodon-data/posts.json --file=dist/posts.json --remote`
2. Verify file exists in R2: `npx wrangler r2 object get octodon-data/posts.json --file=test.json --remote`
3. Check worker logs: `npx wrangler tail`
4. Verify R2 binding in wrangler.toml

title: Implement /api/v1/apps endpoint for Mastodon client compatibility
description:
Elk (and likely other Mastodon clients) cannot preview the instance in read-only mode because the server doesn't support app registration.

**Error from Elk:**
```
{"url":"/api/octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/login","statusCode":400,"statusMessage":"App not registered for server: octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev","message":"App not registered for server: octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev"}
```

**Root Cause:**
Mastodon clients (like Elk, Ivory, Phanpy) expect to register an OAuth application via the `POST /api/v1/apps` endpoint before accessing the API, even in read-only mode.

**What's needed:**
Implement `POST /api/v1/apps` endpoint in worker.ts that:
1. Accepts app registration requests with `client_name`, `redirect_uris`, `scopes`, `website`
2. Returns a mock OAuth app response with `client_id` and `client_secret`
3. Doesn't need to persist data (can generate dummy credentials)
4. Allows clients to proceed with public/anonymous timeline browsing

**Expected behavior:**
After implementing this, users should be able to add the instance to Elk and other Mastodon clients and browse public posts in read-only mode.

**References:**
- Mastodon API docs: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/methods/apps/#create
- Elk login flow: `POST /api/{server}/login` → requires app registration first

title: Remove hardcoded links in build.ts and use account.json whenever possible
Implement followers and following collection endpoints
description:
Implement ActivityPub collection endpoints for followers and following lists.

**Endpoints:**
- `GET /users/{username}/followers` 
- `GET /users/{username}/following`

**Response format (OrderedCollection):**
```json
{
  "@context": "https://www.w3.org/ns/activitystreams",
  "id": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/followers",
  "type": "OrderedCollection",
  "totalItems": 0,
  "first": "https://octodon.stepan-kuzmin.workers.dev/users/stepan/followers?page=1"
}
```

**Implementation options:**

**Option A: Empty collections (minimal):**
- Return empty collections with totalItems: 0
- No persistence needed
- Sufficient for read-only federation

**Option B: Actual follower tracking:**
- Store followers in R2 or Cloudflare KV
- Track when Follow activities are accepted
- Return paginated list of follower Actor IDs
- Enables proper federation with follower counts

**Implementation notes:**
- For static Octodon, following list is always empty (no following anyone)
- Followers list requires Inbox processing and storage
- Can start with Option A and upgrade to Option B later
- Add proper content-type and CORS headers

**Dependencies:**
- Requires Actor endpoint (octodon-0541)
- Option B requires Inbox implementation (octodon-87e5)

**References:**
- ActivityPub Collections: https://www.w3.org/TR/activitypub/#collections
- Mastodon collections: https://docs.joinmastodon.org/spec/activitypub/#Collection
